intro: Taraxacum wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, including parts of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a single, hollow stem that supports a yellow flower head. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that are typical of the genus Taraxacum. This species is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
